events.originalText: The pilots of a Sukhoi Superjet, ignoring alerts from the terrain warning system, crashed the aircraft into Mount Salak in Indonesia, resulting in the deaths of all 45 people on board.
events.subtitle: Sukhoi Superjet 100
events.headline: Sukhoi Superjet crashes into Mount Salak, killing 45

events.originalText: Pope Benedict XVI began the beatification process for his predecessor Pope John Paul II, waiving the standard five years required after the nominee's death.
events.subtitle: Pope Benedict XVI
events.headline: Pope Benedict XVI waives waiting period for Pope John Paul II beatification

events.originalText: Police at the Ohene Djan Stadium in Accra, Ghana, fired tear gas to quell unrest at a football match, leading to a stampede that killed 126 people.
events.subtitle: Accra Sports Stadium
events.headline: 126 killed in stampede at Ohene Djan Stadium in Accra

events.originalText: An underground methane explosion occurred at the Westray Mine in Plymouth, Nova Scotia, killing all 26 Canadian coal miners who were working at the time.
events.subtitle: Methane
events.headline: 26 Canadian miners killed in Westray Mine explosion

events.originalText: Part of the Sunshine Skyway Bridge in Florida collapsed after a pier was struck by the MV Summit Venture, killing 35 people.
events.subtitle: Sunshine Skyway Bridge
events.headline: 35 dead as part of Sunshine Skyway Bridge collapses in Florida

events.originalText: Prominent Iranian Jew Habib Elghanian was executed after having been convicted by a revolutionary tribunal of various charges, triggering a mass exodus of Jews from Iran.
events.subtitle: Persian Jews
events.headline: Prominent Iranian Jew Habib Elghanian executed, triggering mass exodus

events.originalText: The Hotel Polen in Amsterdam was destroyed by fire (pictured), leaving 33 people dead.
events.subtitle: Amsterdam
events.headline: Fire destroys Hotel Polen in Amsterdam, 33 dead

events.originalText: Ngô Đình Cẩn, a younger brother and the confidant of South Vietnam's first president, Ngô Đình Diệm, was executed by Nguyễn Khánh's military junta.
events.subtitle: Ngô Đình Cẩn
events.headline: Ngô Đình Cẩn executed by Nguyễn Khánh's military junta

events.originalText: In a speech to U.S. broadcasters, FCC chairman Newton Minow described commercial television programming as "a vast wasteland".
events.subtitle: Federal Communications Commission
events.headline: FCC chairman Newton Minow criticizes commercial TV programming

events.originalText: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration announced that it would approve the use of Searle's Enovid, the first combined oral contraceptive pill.
events.subtitle: Food and Drug Administration
events.headline: FDA approves Searle's Enovid as first combined oral contraceptive pill

events.originalText: World War II: The Japanese Take Ichi convoy arrived at Halmahera in the Dutch East Indies after losing many ships and thousands of troops to Allied attacks while attempting to carry two divisions of troops from China to New Guinea.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese Take Ichi convoy arrives at Halmahera after heavy losses

events.originalText: First World War: Germany repelled Britain's second attempt to blockade the Belgian port of Ostend.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Germany repels Britain's blockade attempt at Belgian port of Ostend

events.originalText: An earthquake struck northern Chile, leading to the deaths of 2,385 people, mostly victims of the ensuing tsunami, as far away as Hawaii and Fiji.
events.subtitle: 1877 Iquique earthquake
events.headline: 2,385 dead in Chile earthquake and tsunami, reaching Hawaii and Fiji

events.originalText: Second Schleswig War: The Battle of Heligoland (depicted), the last naval engagement fought by squadrons of wooden ships, took place between the Danish and Austro-Prussian fleets.
events.subtitle: Second Schleswig War
events.headline: Battle of Heligoland: Last naval engagement with wooden ships fought
